notes: The model correctly identified the code as safe with high confidence. The original vulnerability was an access control bypass where EthCrossChainManager could call privileged functions on EthCrossChainData without restrictions. The fix implemented a whitelist mechanism (allowedTargets mapping) that explicitly restricts which contracts can be targeted for cross-chain execution. In the patched code, the constructor sets allowedTargets[_dataContract] = false, preventing the data contract from being called. Additionally, line 109 requires(allowedTargets[toContract], "Target not allowed") enforces this restriction. The model correctly recognized this fix and did not report any false positives.
